distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for strongswan fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-9022: Insufficient Input Validation in gmp Plugin leads to Denial of service (bsc#1039514)
- CVE-2017-9023: Incorrect x509 ASN.1 parser error handling could lead to Denial of service  (bsc#1039515)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

relationships.relates_to_product_reference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 11 SP4

notes.text: The gmp plugin in strongSwan before 5.5.3 does not properly validate RSA public keys before calling mpz_powm_sec, which allows remote peers to cause a denial of service (floating point exception and process crash) via a crafted certificate.
notes.title: CVE description

notes.text: The ASN.1 parser in strongSwan before 5.5.3 improperly handles CHOICE types when the x509 plugin is enabled, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted certificate.
notes.title: CVE description

fixed: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 SP4:strongswan-4.4.0-6.35.1.i586
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 SP4:strongswan-4.4.0-6.35.1.ia64
